title: Herby cheese scones with Serrano ham

ingredients.item: 250g self-raising flour, plus extra to dust
125g rindless Taleggio cheese, cut into 1cm cubes
75g organic sun-ripened tomatoes in oil, drained and finely chopped, from the deli counter
½ x 25g pack fresh basil, roughly chopped

instructions.step: Preheat the oven to 220°C, gas mark 7. Line a large baking sheet with baking parchment.  Place the flour, seasoning, bicarbonate of soda and butter in a large mixing bowl. Rub together with your fingertips until the mixture resembles breadcrumbs. Fold in the buttermilk, cheese, tomatoes and basil, then lightly knead until you have a sticky dough.  Turn the dough out onto a floured board. Dust the top with a little flour then use your hands to press the dough evenly into a round, about 3cm deep. Using a 7.5cm cutter, cut out 8 scones, gently reforming the off-cuts as you go. Place on the baking sheet, spacing them out well, and bake in the oven for 15 minutes until golden brown. Serve warm with the Serrano ham.
